name: wetty
description: Wetty is a self-hosted web-based terminal that exposes SSH access through the browser. It replaces traditional terminal apps with a responsive web UI, letting users reach shell sessions securely from anywhere without extra client software.
features: Browser-based terminal: Access SSH sessions directly from any web browser without installing terminal software.
SSH connectivity: Connect to remote servers using standard SSH protocol with key or password authentication.
Responsive interface: Use the terminal on desktop, tablet, or mobile devices with touch-friendly controls.
Copy-paste support: Transfer commands and output between your local system and the terminal easily.
Session persistence: Maintain terminal sessions even when closing the browser tab with reconnection support.
Multiple sessions: Open multiple terminal tabs or windows to work on different servers simultaneously.
Customizable appearance: Adjust font size, color schemes, and terminal themes for comfortable viewing.
Keyboard shortcuts: Use familiar terminal keyboard shortcuts for efficient command-line navigation.
SSL/TLS encryption: Secure all terminal traffic with HTTPS to protect credentials and sensitive data.
Authentication options: Integrate with existing authentication systems or use built-in user management.
Lightweight deployment: Run on minimal resources making it suitable for jump boxes or bastion hosts.
Audit logging: Record terminal sessions for compliance and security review purposes.
